intro: Jossinia brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed jossia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Jossinia brachypoda is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
